name: Infographic Strip
description: Horizontal band displaying 3-5 icon-and-stat pairs in a single row, combining simple iconography with numeric highlights and short labels. Used as a visual break between narrative sections to reinforce key metrics or concepts at a glance.

grid.margins: $spacing-09 (48px) above/below strip, internal items spaced equally

components: PatternBlock(infographic-strip) as root container with g10 or $blue-10 background
Stat items (3-5 repeated): icon + number + label grouping
Icon: Carbon pictogram (32px) or custom SVG in $blue-60, centered above the stat
Stat number: $display-01 in $text-01, the primary visual element
Stat label: $label-01 in $text-03, 2-4 words max below the number
Divider lines: optional 1px $ui-03 vertical separators between items
Background: full-width $ui-01 (g10) or $blue-10 band for visual differentiation
rules: Minimum 3, maximum 5 items — fewer looks sparse, more becomes a KPI grid (use that pattern instead)
All items must have the same structure: icon + number + label — no mixing text-only with icon items
Icons use Carbon pictograms at 32px — consistent size and style across all items in the strip
Stat numbers use $display-01 — the dominant visual element, numbers should be the first thing scanned
Labels use $label-01 in $text-03 — secondary information, 2-4 words maximum
Full-width background band ($ui-01 or $blue-10) differentiates the strip from surrounding white body content
Equal horizontal spacing between all items — use CSS flexbox with justify-content: space-around
Strip must not break across pages — entire band is a single visual unit

printBehavior.pagePosition: flexible — visual break between narrative sections
printBehavior.bleedHandling: background band extends to page trim edges (full-bleed)

accessibilityNotes: Each stat item should use aria-label combining icon meaning, number, and label
Icons must have alt text or aria-label — decorative icons should have aria-hidden='true'
Use <dl> (definition list) markup for the icon/number/label groups
Full-width background must maintain WCAG AA contrast with all text within the strip
antiPatterns: Never exceed 5 items — at 6+ items, switch to the KPI grid pattern which handles density better
Never mix items with and without icons — visual inconsistency breaks the strip's rhythm
Never use body typography for stat numbers — $display-01 scale is required to justify the infographic treatment
Never place an infographic strip adjacent to a KPI grid — they serve similar purposes and compete visually
Never use the strip for complex data that requires explanation — strips are for simple, pre-digested metrics only
